New Records: England reached 170 with all 10 wickets in 16 overs, a new record for the fastest victory in a T20 World Cup semi-final
Alex Hales and Jos Buttler's opening partnership of 166 is the highest for England in a T20 match
Key Match Events: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler's opening partnership
An all-run four completed after Mohammed Shami's error
Jos Buttler hit a six off Suryakumar Yadav's dismissal to seal the victory
Pre-Game Insights: England chose Alex Hales as opener over Dawid Malan
Jos Buttler decided to chase after winning the toss despite the consensus against it
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler praised Hardik Pandya's innings but called it a 'good wicket'
England's victory was seen as a transformation in their tournament performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was England's first successful chase of over 160 in a T20 World Cup
The win was compared to their 2019 World Cup final victory
Others: The match was played at the same ground where England lost to Bangladesh in 2015
